column4: How many things are x86 but not amd64? Lots of just a few now?
hmm, I see pearpc is still i386 only still
and wine is WAY out of date...
since amd64 is the future, it's getting better
: True, but my problem is I want to use some programs that are no-longer developed, so the chance of them being fixed to work on amd64 is non-existant
if it's open source, someone might take the old codes and fix them, if it's not, then, try something else
: I'm not aware of any alternatives to pearpc (mac emulator)
pearpc is available for amd64
Not according to the site that I was pointed to
it's GPL licensed. go to a better site
: Erm, licence doesn't mean anything. It doesn't compile because it's not 64bit clean
http://packages.gentoo.org/search/?sstring=pearpc
Erm, that's Gentoo, not Ubuntu, and it does NOT compile, I'll pastebin the output if you want
if you couldn't compile it in ubuntu, take the gentoo patch, being <testing> means it compiles for most
I use packages in ubuntu rather than source
it builds, and it's open source, so someone can still fix bugs
Why isn't it listed with amd64 on the packages.ubuntu site then?
ubuntu is a distribution for n00bs, even though it has a ubuntu server now
Why is it much better?
amd64 is the future, all x86 cpu will be amd64(x86-64) soon
I know
